cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP5 ALL
TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM

BULLETIN
Tropical Depression Irwin Advisory Number  41
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL       EP102017
800 AM PDT Tue Aug 01 2017

...IRWIN FORECAST TO BECOME A REMNANT LOW LATER TODAY...

SUMMARY OF 800 AM PDT...1500 UTC...INFORMATION
----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...25.9N 129.2W
ABOUT 1230 MI...1980 KM WNW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...35 MPH...55 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...NNW OR 335 DEGREES AT 10 MPH...17 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1007 MB...29.74 INCHES


WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.


DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK
------------------------------
At 800 AM PDT (1500 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Irwin
was located near latitude 25.9 North, longitude 129.2 West. The
depression is moving toward the north-northwest near 10 mph (17
km/h).  A motion toward the northwest should begin later today.

Maximum sustained winds have decreased to near 35 mph (55 km/h)
with higher gusts. Irwin is forecast to become a remnant low later
today.

The estimated minimum central pressure is 1007 mb (29.74 inches).


HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None.


NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
Next complete advisory at 200 PM PDT.

$$
Forecaster Avila

NNNN
